line_1: Trembling he stopp'd; his heart with horror froze:
Glimmer'd their last; whose sluggish blood, half froze,
line_2: Creeps lab'ring thro' the veins; whose heart ne'er glows

line_1: Parch'd in the sun, in dark December froze.
line_2: Still with the morning's orient light I rose,

line_1: And horror at the sight her vital spirits froze.
line_2: Nor was this all, for as the tumult rose,

line_1: And horror at the sight her vital spirits froze.
line_2: The secret dens their venomed hoards disclose,

line_1: For well their Feet may halt when they are froze;
line_2: My Verses dare not yet their worth expose,

line_1: Ere life's warm torrent to the fountain froze,
line_2: Yet, ere he sunk in Nature's last repose,

line_1: Thy limbs have fail'd — thy blood has froze! —
line_2: Enough! — thy starting locks have rose —

line_1: Parch'd in the sun, in dark December froze.
line_2: Still with the morning's orient light I rose,

line_1: Guilt's trembling breath his heart's red current froze,
line_2: When lo! each injur'd apparition rose;
